section.heading: Authority to issue grants for crime reduction and violence interruption.

para.text: The Attorney General may issue grants for the purposes of crime reduction and violence interruption.

Personnel and non-personnel costs related to administering any grants issued pursuant to the authority provided in subsection (a) of this section may be paid from funds deposited into the Litigation Support Fund established in § 1-301.86b.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Attorney General Grant-Making Authority Emergency Amendment Act of 2019 (D.C. Act 23-135, Oct. 23, 2019, 66 DCR 14307).
For temporary (225 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Attorney General Grant-Making Authority Temporary Amendment Act of 2019 (D.C. Law 23-42, Jan. 10, 2020, 66 DCR 15334).
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Fiscal Year 2020 Budget Support Clarification Second Emergency Amendment Act of 2019 (D.C. Act 23-201, Jan. 22, 2020, 67 DCR 731).
Section 16 of D.C. Law 23-68 provided that the changes made to this section by D.C. Law 23-68 shall apply as of October 1, 2019.
